On 4/19/06, cant_jim <Cant_jim@...> wrote:
>
> I'm writing a class =
(extending TestCase) which tests an object I get
> from a factory method.  =
The first test method asks the Factory for the
> object and subsequent test=
s methods exercise the returned object.
>
> If any method fails, I know all=
 the remaing ones will fail.  How can I
> prevent the subsequent tests from=
 being run?  (I assume the test
> methods are invoked in the order the appe=
ar in the TestCase.)


This is a good example where dependent methods as pr=
ovided by
TestNG<http://testng.org>would come in handy:

@Test
public void =
retrieveObject() {
  m_object =3D Factory.getObject();
  assertNotNull(m_ob=
ject);
}

@Test(dependsOnMethods =3D "retrieveObject")
public void someTest=
() {
  // test m_object
}

If everything goes well, you will get "2 PASSED,=
 0 FAILED".  If the factory
fails to return the object, all the test method=
s that depend on
"retrieveObject" will be skipped and you will get "0 PASSE=
D, 1 FAILED, 1
SKIP".

Note that dependent methods introduce a new status f=
or your tests:  on top
of PASS and FAIL, you now have SKIP, which indicates=
 that this test didn't
run because its dependency could not be satisfied.

=
--
C=E9dric
http://testng.org
